findings.title: Reentrancy via external call before state update
findings.explanation: The contract calls msg.sender.call.value(...) before setting the user's balance to zero. This allows an attacker to re-enter the contract (e.g., calling transfer or withdrawBalance again) and withdraw funds multiple times before their balance is updated.
findings.fix_suggestion: Apply the checks-effects-interactions pattern: update the user balance (effects) before making any external calls (interactions), or use a reentrancy guard modifier to prevent recursive calls.

findings.title: Missing SafeMath for balance update
findings.explanation: The contract performs addition and subtraction on userBalances without overflow/underflow checks. An attacker could exploit integer overflow or underflow to manipulate balances.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use a SafeMath library (e.g., OpenZeppelin SafeMath) for all arithmetic operations on unsigned integers to prevent overflow and underflow.
